page.title: 20DIALYSIS IN SOUTH ELKINGTON
page.content: 4 yrs.ago a 40yr.old family man living in S.Elkington faced a diagnosis of kidney failure.He underwent a kidney transplant operation but this proved unsuccessful,and he was forced to travel 100 miles twice a week to the Princess Royal Hospital,Hull to dialyse.Both he and his wife were trained to operate the machine.Their garden was prepared for a cabin,drains dug,electric cable laid, and the cabin arrived by transporter.Watched by the school children and their teachers it was taken across a field and lifted by crane onto its site.This man dialyses for 4 hrs.3 days a week at times when he can immediately contact Hull in an emergency using a phone in the cabin. His wife is alerted by an alarm bell in the house.All the family have had to adjust,holidays are spent in a specially equipped caravan near Whitby
